= General Performance =

[[TOC]]

||'''Status'''||Work in Progress||

circuits comes with a general purpose benchmarking
tool used to benchmark the core of circuits. This
tool is normally installed as {{{circuits.bench}}}

On the following environment, this is how circuits
fairs up:
||'''CPU'''      ||AMD Athlon(tm) 64 Processor 3800+||
||'''CPU Cores'''||1                                ||
||'''CPU Speed'' ||2.4Ghz                           ||
||'''RAM'''      ||1GB                              ||
||'''OS'''       ||CRUX 2.5 (32bit)                 ||
||''Python''     ||2.6.1                            ||

== Speed Test ==

=== With JIT (psyco) ===
{{{
#!sh
prologic@daisy
Wed Mar 18 19:57:30
~/circuits-dev
$ circuits.bench -e 100000 -s
Setting up Speed Test...

Total Events: 100005 (67335/s after 1.49s)
}}}

=== Without JIT ===
{{{
#!sh
prologic@daisy
Wed Mar 18 19:59:06
~/circuits-dev
$ circuits.bench -e 100000   
Setting up Speed Test...

Total Events: 100005 (48263/s after 2.07s)
}}}
